thread.title: Match and Replace Molding In Your House With Help From a Profile Jig
thread.title_full: Match and Replace Molding In Your House With Help From a Profile Jig

author: Patrick Allan
title: Match and Replace Molding In Your House With Help From a Profile Jig
text:
Go to permalink 
Damaged molding along the floors and ceilings of your home need replacing, but some moldings are very ornate, especially if the house is old. Here’s how to use a simple tool to capture the profile of a molding so you can replace it. Advertisement 
In this video from the This Old House YouTube channel , contractor Tom Silva shows host Kevin O’Connor how to use a profile jig, or a contour gauge duplicator as some may know it, to easily capture the shape of fancy molding. All you have to do is push the flat set of pins into the molding and pull it away. Then you can trace the molding’s pattern on a piece of paper that you can take to a carpenter or housing contractor for them to replicate. 
You can also take in an actual piece of the molding, but this method is simple and prevents any further damage to your moldings. And the tool itself usually costs less than $10 . Of course, if your molding is only damaged a little, it’s not too hard to repair it yourself with an all-purpose joint compound .
